definitions.definition: Firmly held together; compact; not loose or open.
definitions.example: a tight sponge; a tight knot

definitions.definition: (of a space, design or arrangement) Narrow, such that it is difficult for something or someone to pass through it.
definitions.example: The passageway was so tight we could barely get through.
Their marching band is extremely tight.

definitions.definition: (slang) Intoxicated; drunk or acting like being drunk.
definitions.example: We went drinking and got tight.
We had a very tight schedule.

definitions.definition: (poker) Of a player, who plays very few hands. (Can we add an example for this sense?)
(poker) Using a strategy which involves playing very few hands. (Can we add an example for this sense?)

definitions.example: tight control on a situation; tight clothing
Make sure to pull the rope tight.
I grew up in a poor neighborhood; money was very tight, but we made do.
We've grown tighter over the years.

definitions.definition: (slang, figuratively, usually derogatory) Miserly or frugal.
definitions.example: He's a bit tight with his money.

meanings.partOfSpeech:
the passageway was so tight we could barely get through.
they flew in a tight formation.

definitions.definition: Fitting close, or too close, to the body.
definitions.example: a tight coat;â€ƒ My socks are too tight.

definitions.definition: Of a turn, sharp, so that the timeframe for making it is narrow and following it is difficult.
definitions.example: The mountain pass was made dangerous by its many tight corners.

definitions.definition: Lacking holes; difficult to penetrate; waterproof.
